docs.snippet: MOSCOW, July 21 -- The Soviet public today absorbed the widest news coverage ever given by its Government-controlled media to an American space venture.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, July 21 -- The Soviet public today absorbed the widest news coverage ever given by its Government-controlled media to an American space venture.
docs.abstract: tape of lunar walk shown on USSR TV; Pravda, Izvestia run landing story on 1st page; USSR scientists Dr K P Feoktistov and G I Petrov hail mission's success; reaction, Moscow, discussed; illus

docs.snippet: The First Hanover Corporation, its president and three other defendants were indicted here yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of violating the Federal Reserve Board's margin requirements.
docs.lead_paragraph: The First Hanover Corporation, its president and three other defendants were indicted here yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of violating the Federal Reserve Board's margin requirements.
docs.abstract: co, pres Lerner, Internatl Systems & Controls (formerly Houston Oil Field Material Co), Amer Securities Co of Montevideo and its pres H Raggio indicted by Fed grand jury on charges of violating Fed Reserve margin requirements; US Atty Morgenthau says Internatl Systems, aided by other defendants, used margin violations to buy stock in its effort to acquire Holly Sugar; indictment of Internatl Systems is believed 1st against alleged beneficiary of illegal use of margin; Lerner statement denies intent to violate laws; indictment refers to Internatl Systems predecessor as Homco

headline.main: Brokerage House Indicted on Margin; Brokerage Concern Is Indicted On Violation of Margin Ruling

docs.snippet: PRAGUE, July 26 -- Cierna, the small railroad junction on the border between Slovakia and the Soviet Ukraine where the liberal reformers from Prague and the Moscow leadership clashed grimly almost a year ago, is in the news again.
docs.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE, July 26 -- Cierna, the small railroad junction on the border between Slovakia and the Soviet Ukraine where the liberal reformers from Prague and the Moscow leadership clashed grimly almost a year ago, is in the news again.
docs.abstract: Reloading of meat and other goods from broad-gauge Soviet can to regular-gauge Czech cars, Cierna, causes bottleneck delaying urgently needed food shipments to Czech

headline.main: With Czech Food Scarce, Meat From Soviet Piles Up at Border

docs.snippet: MOSCOW -- In the lobby of a downtown Moscow office building there is an enormous map of the world with the "fraternal Socialist countries" colored appropriately in red. Soviet citizens who are curious may wonder when Communist China will get a new...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- In the lobby of a downtown Moscow office building there is an enormous map of the world with the "fraternal Socialist countries" colored appropriately in red. Soviet citizens who are curious may wonder when Communist China will get a new tint or whether Rumania should not be a shade lighter.

docs.snippet: Alfred M. Lerner, the 37-year-old president of the First Hanover Corporation, a brokerage-firm member of the New York and American Stock Exchanges, was indicted yester day on fraud charges.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alfred M. Lerner, the 37-year-old president of the First Hanover Corporation, a brokerage-firm member of the New York and American Stock Exchanges, was indicted yester day on fraud charges.
docs.abstract: First Hanover Corp pres Lerner is indicted on fraud charges for failing to state in prospectuses filed with SEC that substantial shares in new issues of Basic Leasing, Weight Watchers Internatl and Internatl Computing Services underwritten by First Hanover were sold to Gama Shipping, co in which he is officer and owns 48% of stock; US Atty Morgenthau says all issues opened at well over offering price; stock reptdly was bought for Gama by number of Swiss banks; Lerner statement denies intention to violate laws

headline.main: Head of First Hanover Indicted On Charge of New-Issue Fraud; BROKER INDICTED ON FRAUD CHARGE

docs.snippet: TEL AVIV, Aug. 4 (Reuters) -- The Uruguayan basketball team that was barred from the Maccabiah Games because it included non-Jewish players was declared eligible today to play by a district court judged.
